schema.title: FluidModel
schema.description: A Fluid Model is a mathematical model which describes the fluid behaviour. It is often derived from sources such as laboratory fluid sample analysis. Fluid models typically contain properties that can be defined using tables (e.g. Black Oil Table), using Equation of State formulation methods, using correlations, or a combination of the above. Fluid models are frequently an input for reservoir simulation.

id.description: Previously called ResourceID or SRN which identifies this OSDU resource object without version.
id.title: Entity ID

kind.description: The schema identification for the OSDU resource object following the pattern {Namespace}:{Source}:{Type}:{VersionMajor}.{VersionMinor}.{VersionPatch}. The versioning scheme follows the semantic versioning, https://semver.org/.
kind.title: Entity Kind

version.description: The version number of this OSDU resource; set by the framework.
version.title: Version Number

acl.description: The access control tags associated with this entity.
acl.title: Access Control List

legal.description: The entity's legal tags and compliance status. The actual contents associated with the legal tags is managed by the Compliance Service.
legal.title: Legal Tags

tags.title: Tag Dictionary
tags.description: A generic dictionary of string keys mapping to string value. Only strings are permitted as keys and values.

createTime.description: Timestamp of the time at which initial version of this OSDU resource object was created. Set by the System. The value is a combined date-time string in ISO-8601 given in UTC.
createTime.title: Resource Object Creation DateTime

createUser.title: Resource Object Creation User Reference
createUser.description: The user reference, which created the first version of this resource object. Set by the System.

modifyTime.description: Timestamp of the time at which this version of the OSDU resource object was created. Set by the System. The value is a combined date-time string in ISO-8601 given in UTC.
modifyTime.title: Resource Object Version Creation DateTime

modifyUser.title: Resource Object Version Creation User Reference
modifyUser.description: The user reference, which created this version of this resource object. Set by the System.

ancestry.description: The links to data, which constitute the inputs, from which this record instance is derived.
ancestry.title: Ancestry

meta.description: The Frame of Reference meta data section linking the named properties to self-contained definitions.
meta.title: Frame of Reference Meta Data

FluidModelTypeID.title: Fluid Model Type ID
FluidModelTypeID.description: Identifies the type of model used. Models can support one or more business contexts. E.g., for Reservoir Simulation, key types of fluid models are Black Oil, Compositional, and Thermal Compositional.

BasisOfModelling.title: Basis Of Modelling
BasisOfModelling.description: This set of attributes represents the context surrounding the processes used in running through model characterization.

InputDataCollectionID.title: Input Data Collection ID
InputDataCollectionID.description: Identifies the Persisted Collection containing relevant data used to derive this model, except for Samples Analysis, which are identified by InputSampleAnalysisIDs.

ModelPropertyFormulationMethods.title: Model Property Formulation Methods
ModelPropertyFormulationMethods.description: This provides an array of fluid model definition properties and the methodology used in estimating its property values.

items.title: Model Property Formulation Method
items.description: This captures information around the fluid model definition property and the methodology used in estimating its property values.

ModelPropertyTypeID.title: Model Property Type ID
ModelPropertyTypeID.description: Identifies the fluid model property available in the model definition. Typical properties referenced here will include phase equilibrium values, densities, water compressibilities and viscosities.

ModelPropertyFormulationMethodID.title: Model Property Formulation Method ID
ModelPropertyFormulationMethodID.description: Identifies the formulation method used in generating the numerical values assigned to the model property. E.g, Peng-Robinson

ModellingApplicationsUsed.title: Modelling Applications Used
ModellingApplicationsUsed.description: The software applications used in creating this model. For example, this could be a PVT software application that is used to create the tabular data. Best practice is to also capture the application version.

IntendedWorkflowUsageIDs.title: Intended Workflow Usage IDs
IntendedWorkflowUsageIDs.description: Identifies the subsequent business workflows for which this data is intended to be used.

IsOptimizedForEnhancedRecoveryStudies.title: Optimized For Enhanced Recovery Studies
IsOptimizedForEnhancedRecoveryStudies.description: Indicates whether or not this model is intended to be applied for enhanced recovery studies.

IsModelPvtOptimized.title: Is Model Pvt Optimized
IsModelPvtOptimized.description: Indicates whether or not this fluid model is optimized or generated from an optimized application model using required PVT data.

IsModelViscosityOptimized.title: Is Model Viscosity Optimized
IsModelViscosityOptimized.description: Indicates whether or not the fluid model is optimized or generated from an optimized application model on validated viscosity data.

IsCompositionLumped.title: Is Composition Lumped
IsCompositionLumped.description: Indicates whether or not the components described in the model are lumped, meaning the list of components has some components combined together, resulting in a more limited list as compared with the reported compositional analysis, which has the full, extended, component list. A "false" value indicates the components are not lumped, but rather extended, as found in the full compositional analysis. This is mostly applicable in Equation of State Model scenarios, with "true" being most common to support the Reservoir Simulation workflow.

ComponentCount.title: Component Count
ComponentCount.description: This provides the number of components used in characterizing the model. This is mostly applicable in Equation of State Model scenarios.

BlackOilFlashMechanismAppliedID.title: Black Oil Flash Mechanism Applied ID
BlackOilFlashMechanismAppliedID.description: Identifies the liberation or flash process that was selected as most likely to represent the depletion in the reservoir, and therefore applied to create the Black Oil model. This is only applicable for Black Oil models.

ParentModelID.title: Parent Model ID
ParentModelID.description: This is used, as a form of lineage, to explicitly indicate the fluid model OSDU record from which this fluid model was derived. Only to be used in the case that this fluid model is derived from another.

DatePublished.title: Date Published
DatePublished.description: This represents the date the model generated was published and made available to the consumers or downstream applications.

ModellingContacts.title: Modelling Contacts
ModellingContacts.description: Information about the analysts responsible for creating the model.

ModelAreaOfInterestIDs.title: Model Area Of Interest IDs
ModelAreaOfInterestIDs.description: A list of specific areas or business objects within which this model definition can be applied; E.g. Reservoir, ReservoirSegment, or Wellbore.

IsApplicableForThermalSimulation.title: Is Applicable For Thermal Simulation
IsApplicableForThermalSimulation.description: Indicates whether or not this model can be applied for simulation of thermal systems (thermodynamic systems in which the temperature of the system varies, as opposed to isothermal systems, in which the temperature remains constant).

FluidModelSaturationTypeID.title: Fluid Model Saturation Type ID
FluidModelSaturationTypeID.description: Identifies the type of saturation system the model was built for, such as a bubble point or a dew point fluid system.

HasVariableDepthFluidProperties.title: Has Variable Depth Fluid Properties
HasVariableDepthFluidProperties.description: Indicates whether or not this fluid model consists of composition or other fluid properties (implied by Fluid Model Type) that vary by depth.

Remarks.title: Remarks
Remarks.description: An array containing operational or quality comments pertaining to the fluid model represented by this work product component.
